study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the applicability of initial brain metastasis velocity (iBMV) as a prognostic metric in breast cancer brain metastases (BCBM) patients treated with radiotherapy and to analyze the role of biological subtypes in disease dynamics.
results_summary: The study found that iBMV independently predicted mortality and that biological subtype significantly influenced the time interval between initial breast cancer diagnosis and brain metastasis occurrence. Karnofsky performance status and HER2 status were the strongest predictors of overall survival.
population_specificity: 126 breast cancer brain metastases (BCBM) patients treated with radiotherapy (SRS/FSRT and WBRT) between 2013 and 2020.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze and compare co-created interventions by adolescents in four European countries to address unhealthy behaviors related to snacking and physical activity.
results_summary: The study found that most identified barriers were addressed in the interventions, but facilitators were insufficiently addressed. The interventions varied widely in activities and frequency, making direct comparisons difficult.
population_specificity: Adolescents from Greece, Spain, The Netherlands, and the United Kingdom.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to profile the nutritional and anti-nutritional bioactive compounds in M. uniflorum seeds fried at different temperatures and assess their antioxidant properties.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in tannin (52.4%) and phytic acid (46.3%) compared to raw seeds, with the highest protein recovery (50.13% and 54.74%) in samples fried at 70°C and 90°C. Antioxidant assays showed high antioxidant power (~80%) in 3 kDa cut-off samples fried at 70°C.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on seeds)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the biopriming potential of Cucumis sativus L. seeds using extracts from cyanobacterial consortia treated with static magnetic fields (SMF) to enhance seedling growth and crop productivity.
results_summary: The study found that biopriming with SMF-treated cyanobacterial extracts significantly improved seedling growth parameters, including root and stem length, vigor index, and fresh biomass, with the 40-50 mT SMF treatment showing the most pronounced effects. The extracts also maintained balanced nutritional uptake and plant health.
population_specificity: Cucumis sativus L. (cucumber) seeds
effective_dosage: Not specified (extracts applied as biopriming agents)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if hydropriming could mitigate heat-stress-mediated impacts on germination performance in orphan legumes.
results_summary: Hydropriming improved germination and seedling development under heat stress in a species-specific manner, with evidence of DNA damage repair and altered gene expression in L. sativus.
population_specificity: Seeds of Lathyrus sativus L., Pisum sativum var. arvense, and Trigonella foenum-graecum L.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of calcium hypochlorite and peroxyacetic acid treatments in inactivating enterohemorrhagic Escherichia coli (EHEC) on alfalfa seeds and sprouts.
results_summary: Both sanitizers effectively reduced EHEC populations on seeds and sprouts, with calcium hypochlorite showing greater efficacy than peroxyacetic acid. The effectiveness varied by bacterial isolate, with E. coli O157:H7 K4492 being the most resistant.
population_specificity: Alfalfa seeds and sprouts contaminated with EHEC.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of a silydianin-rich extract from Silybum marianum seeds on enteroviral infections in vitro and its potential to mitigate delayed gastric emptying in mice.
results_summary: The silydianin-rich extract demonstrated consistent antiviral activity, particularly against EV71, and significantly improved gastric emptying in mice at 200 mg/kg. It also moderately enhanced gastrointestinal transit.
population_specificity: In vitro (RD cells) and in vivo (mouse model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential benefits of Nigella sativa (black seeds) as an adjuvant therapy for HCV and HBV infections.
results_summary: Preclinical and clinical studies suggest black seeds exhibit antiviral, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and immunomodulatory effects that may alleviate symptoms of HCV and HBV infections. However, further randomized controlled trials are needed to confirm efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with HCV and HBV infections.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to document a rare case of lower gastrointestinal obstruction caused by ingestion of Akebia trifoliata seeds.
results_summary: The study found that ingestion of Akebia trifoliata seeds led to lower gastrointestinal obstruction, confirmed via CT scan and colonoscopy. Treatment resolved the obstruction, but multiple ulcers persisted.
population_specificity: A single patient with recurring abdominal pain and difficulty passing stool.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential palliative effect of pumpkin seed oil (PSO) against colchicine-induced neurotoxic and neurobehavioral effects in rats.
results_summary: PSO effectively attenuated colchicine-induced neurotoxic effects, increasing serotonin and dopamine levels, reducing oxidative stress, and mitigating DNA damage in the brain.
population_specificity: Male rats weighing 245-260 g

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the risk of microplastic uptake by foraging birds from seeds and the effectiveness of natural repellents or coatings in reducing seed predation.
results_summary: The study found that microplastic uptake by birds increased when associated with corn seeds, but coating seeds with a repellent slurry or wrapping them in repellent plastic or hairy cotton fibers significantly reduced predation (up to 86% and complete protection, respectively).
population_specificity: Foraging terrestrial bird species (Pica pica, Corvus cornix, Columba palumbus).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of polyphenolic extracts from grape seed waste as natural nanocarriers, evaluating their stability, antioxidant properties, and wound-healing efficacy.
results_summary: The study found that grape seed extract nanoparticles exhibited high colloidal and chemical stability, strong antioxidant capacity, excellent biocompatibility, and promoted wound healing with controlled infections and inflammation in a rat model. By day 19, wounds treated with GSE NPs were fully healed without scarring, unlike untreated wounds.
population_specificity: Human dermal fibroblasts, RAW 264.7 macrophages, and a rat excision wound model.
effective_dosage: 2% Obeidi GSE NPs in gel formulation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the attractivity of freshly drilled onion and carrot fields to birds and their potential exposure to pesticide-treated seeds on the soil surface.
results_summary: The study found that carrot and onion fields showed limited attractiveness to foraging birds, with decreased bird sightings on the day of drilling and changes in species composition afterward. Seed exposure was higher at field borders, but no granivorous or omnivorous birds were observed foraging post-drilling.
population_specificity: Birds in agricultural landscapes in Minas Gerais, Brazil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of biliary metallic stent (BMS) combined with radioactive 125I seed strands (RISS) for treating malignant hilar obstruction (MHO).
results_summary: The study found that BMS combined with RISS significantly improved stent patency time and overall survival compared to BMS alone, with no significant difference in complications between the groups. The treatment was deemed safe and effective for MHO patients.
population_specificity: Patients with malignant hilar obstruction (MHO) undergoing percutaneous trans-hepatic biliary drainage.
study_duration: Follow-up duration varied, with outcomes measured over months (e.g., stent patency time and overall survival).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-diabetic and anti-lipidemic effects of Centratherum antheminticum seeds powder (Cap CASP 500 mg) in Type-2 diabetes patients.
results_summary: CASP demonstrated significant anti-diabetic activity (72.81% in vitro) and improved in vivo parameters such as HbA1c, fasting blood glucose, lipid profiles, and cardiovascular risk indices after 6 and 12 weeks. The effects were comparable or superior to standard metformin treatment.
population_specificity: 40 Type-2 diabetes patients from Sindh Government Hospital New Karachi and 20 healthy volunteers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Acanthopanax seed polysaccharides (ASP) could improve Alcoholic fatty liver disease (AFLD) by modulating the gut-liver axis.
results_summary: ASP intervention improved liver damage, oxidative stress, and inflammation in AFLD mice while also modifying gut microbiota composition and increasing beneficial bacteria and short-chain fatty acid levels.
population_specificity: AFLD-induced mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how exogenous GR24 affects the metabolism of stored substances and endogenous hormones during the early stages of rice seed germination under salt stress.
results_summary: GR24 pre-treatment significantly improved rice seed germination and seedling growth under salt stress by enhancing enzyme activity, reducing oxidative damage, and regulating hormone levels. It promoted starch decomposition, increased soluble sugars and proteins, and improved antioxidant enzyme activity and hormone balance.
population_specificity: Rice seeds (Oryza sativa) under salt stress conditions.
study_duration: Early stages of germination (specific duration not mentioned)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of purified hydrocolloid seed coatings from different waste sludges and a commercial coating in preventing seed deterioration caused by aging.
results_summary: Coated maize seeds showed higher germination rates and increased antioxidant enzyme activities compared to uncoated seeds, with optimal spraying times varying by wastewater treatment plant source. Principal component analysis identified the best number of sprays for each type of coating.
population_specificity: Maize seeds (no human or animal subjects).
study_duration: Pot experiments conducted at 4 days after aging.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the neuroprotective and neuroplasticity potential of Nigella sativa L and propofol in rats with traumatic brain injury (TBI).
results_summary: The study found that Nigella sativa L and propofol both increased BDNF protein levels, with the combination showing the highest effect. Nigella sativa L alone had a better effect than propofol alone in enhancing neuroplasticity and neuroprotection.
population_specificity: Rats with induced traumatic brain injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Metarhizium marquandii SGSF043 on seed germination, bud growth, and physiological characteristics of Chinese cabbage.
results_summary: The study found that M. marquandii SGSF043 significantly improved seed germination activity, activated the antioxidant system, optimized plant hormone levels, and enhanced stress resistance in Chinese cabbage seedlings.
population_specificity: Chinese cabbage seeds and seedlings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of chia seed oil (CSO) supplementation on growth performance and gut microbiota modulation in Labeo rohita fingerlings.
results_summary: The study found that 1.0% CSO supplementation significantly improved growth performance metrics (weight gain, specific growth rate, feed conversion ratio, and efficiency) and enhanced gut microbial diversity, particularly increasing beneficial bacterial phyla and genera. Metabolic pathway predictions suggested improved nutrient transport and metabolism in the CSO (1) group.
population_specificity: Labeo rohita fingerlings (mean weight = 19.74 ± 0.33 g)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine how different chemical agents and metallic salts affect the activity of α-amylase and protease enzymes in barley seeds.
results_summary: The study found that urea and EDTA completely inhibited enzyme activity at certain concentrations, while acetic acid reduced activity but retained partial function. CaCl₂, Mn²⁺, and Mg²⁺ salts increased enzyme activity, whereas Zn²⁺, Cu²⁺, and Fe²⁺ significantly reduced it.
population_specificity: Barley seeds (no human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Various concentrations (e.g., 8 M urea, 0.50 M EDTA, 20% acetic acid, 0.50 M Ca²⁺).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the neuroprotective effects of Schisandra chinensis seed oil (SOSC) against 3-nitropropionic acid-induced Huntington's disease-like symptoms in a mouse model.
results_summary: SOSC improved movement dysfunction and reduced neuropathology by inhibiting inflammation and oxidative stress in the striatum. It also suppressed NF-κB and MAPK pathways while activating Nrf2, suggesting potential therapeutic benefits for Huntington's disease-like symptoms.
population_specificity: Experimental mouse model (3-NPA-induced Huntington's disease-like symptoms).
effective_dosage: 75, 150, and 300 mg/kg/day, orally administered once daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the qualitative phytochemical composition and evaluate the anthelmintic efficacy of L. chinensis seed ethanolic extract (LCSE).
results_summary: LCSE was rich in various phytochemicals and demonstrated strong, dose-dependent anthelmintic effects, outperforming albendazole at the highest concentration (100 mg/mL) in terms of paralysis and mortality times.
population_specificity: Adult earthworms (Eisenia fetida)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of roasting (microwave vs. conventional oven) on the phytochemical composition, antioxidant capacity, and fatty acid profile of grape seeds.
results_summary: Roasting increased total phenolic and flavonoid content, with microwave roasting showing higher values for some compounds (e.g., gallic acid, resveratrol). Antioxidant activity varied slightly, and fatty acid profiles remained stable, with linoleic acid being the most abundant. The study suggests grape seeds could be a beneficial food ingredient after heat treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or food-based study, no human participants mentioned).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on compositional analysis, not dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to purify, characterize, and assess the antimicrobial activity of a papain inhibitor (TcPI) derived from Terminalia catappa L. seeds.
results_summary: The study found that TcPI is a highly stable, monomeric protein with competitive inhibition specific to papain. It exhibited antimicrobial activity against Candida parapsilosis and Staphylococcus aureus and remained active under extreme heat and pH conditions.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate two strategies for creating injectable biodegradable brachytherapy seeds containing high 103Pd activity to improve flexibility and reduce long-term discomfort compared to traditional methods.
results_summary: Both strategies ([103Pd]PdAuNPs and [103Pd]Pd-SSIB) achieved high radiolabeling yields (83% and 99%, respectively), high activity per seed (1.0-1.5 GBq/mL), and minimal radioactivity release (<1% over one month), demonstrating suitability for brachytherapy. The [16]aneS4 chelator-based strategy was preferred due to higher biodegradability.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and mouse serum testing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of Conocarpus seeds for synthesizing silver nanoparticles (AgNPs) and their effectiveness in wastewater treatment for methylene blue degradation.
results_summary: The study found that AgNPs synthesized from Conocarpus seeds achieved 99.60% removal efficiency of methylene blue under optimal conditions (pH = 3, 1 g sample) within 1 hour, with a maximum adsorption capacity of 49.80 mg·g-1. The AgNPs also demonstrated a 99.76% degradation rate under UV light within 2 hours.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study focused on wastewater treatment).
effective_dosage: 1 g sample (concentration not specified for human consumption).
study_duration: Not specified (experimental timeframes: 50 min to 2 hours).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the pancreatic lipase inhibitory activity and functional properties of Amaranthus cruentus seed protein isolates as potential anti-obesity agents.
results_summary: The protein isolates demonstrated good functional properties and antilipase activity compared to flour, with one protein showing a dose-dependent reduction in lipid content in cell line experiments.
population_specificity: 3T3-L1 cell lines (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the operability and treatment outcomes of TheraAGX100 and TheraStrand-SL seeds in reducing intra-prostatic displacement during brachytherapy for prostate cancer.
results_summary: TheraStrand-SL significantly reduced intra-prostatic displacement incidence and distance compared to TheraAGX100, with no significant differences in migration, dropout, dose-volume histograms, or adverse events between the two groups.
population_specificity: 69 patients receiving brachytherapy for prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antidiabetic, neuroprotective, and antioxidant effects of ethanol extracts of Parkia biglobosa seeds in STZ-induced diabetic rats.
results_summary: The study found that PB seed extracts significantly reduced fasting blood glucose levels, improved cognitive dysfunction, inhibited α-amylase and α-glucosidase activity, and increased antioxidant enzyme activities, with effects comparable to metformin at higher doses.
population_specificity: STZ-induced diabetic rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the occurrence and environmental impact of pesticide residues and degradation products from treated seeds in waterways near a biofuels production facility.
results_summary: The study detected 18 out of 22 target pesticide residues, with clothianidin, thiamethoxam, and imidacloprid desnitro being the most frequently found. Elevated concentrations of these compounds exceeded aquatic toxicity benchmarks, posing risks to non-target organisms.
population_specificity: Aquatic environments and non-target organisms (e.g., algae, Daphnia magna, Fathead Minnow) affected by runoff from a biofuels facility using pesticide-treated seeds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the biochemical mechanisms involved in the removal of dormancy in apple seeds through cold stratification, focusing on reactive oxygen species (ROS) metabolism.
results_summary: The study found that cold stratification modifies ROS levels, which are key regulators of seed dormancy, and identified a time-dependent sequence of biochemical events, including changes in enzyme activities and amino acid levels, crucial for dormancy removal.
population_specificity: Apple (Malus domestica Borkh.) seeds

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how different heat pretreatment methods (steaming, stir-frying, roasting, microwave, and infrared) affect the flavor and physicochemical quality of camellia seeds.
results_summary: Heat-pretreated camellia seeds showed increased oil content and browning degree, with enhanced caramel color and toasty, nutty flavors. The study identified 137 volatile organic compounds (VOCs), including 23 characteristic aroma compounds, and determined 12 key aroma compounds (KACs) through comprehensive analysis.
population_specificity: Camellia seeds (no human or animal subjects specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the hydrological mechanism and endosperm weakening process during dormancy release in Tilia henryana seeds.
results_summary: The study found that endosperm weakening in T. henryana seeds occurs at the radicle-endosperm interface, involving imbalanced GA/ABA levels, depletion of storage materials, and enzymatic activity increases, facilitating radicle elongation. Physiological changes reduced lignin, cellulose, hemicellulose, and pectin content, accelerating endosperm weakening.
population_specificity: Tilia henryana seeds

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential of Cucurbitaceae seed and leaf extracts in preventing and treating colorectal cancer (CRC) by evaluating their antitumor, antiangiogenic, antioxidant, and chemopreventive properties.
results_summary: Cold ethanolic extracts from Cucurbita seeds and leaves showed potent antiproliferative activity against CRC cell lines, induced cell cycle arrest and apoptosis, inhibited tumor clonogenicity and angiogenesis, and modulated cancer stem cell gene expression. The extracts also exhibited antioxidant and chemopreventive effects, with identified bioactive compounds including phenolic and cucurbitane-type triterpenoids.
population_specificity: In vitro study using T-84, HCT-15, and HT-29 colorectal cancer cell lines.
interactions: Slight synergistic effect noted with oxaliplatin.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether spraying salicylic acid (SA) during the grain-filling stage improves the salt tolerance of progeny seeds in wheat.
results_summary: SA treatment during grain-filling increased grain weight and yield, improved germination rates, and enhanced seedling growth under salt stress. It also boosted amylase activity, respiration, and antioxidant defenses while reducing oxidative damage and maintaining ion balance.
population_specificity: Wheat plants (Triticum aestivum L.) and their progeny seeds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of oxygen plasma treatment on the germination rate, growth, and antioxidative activity of mung beans under varying pressures and exposure times.
results_summary: Oxygen plasma treatment significantly improved germination rates (exceeding 90% within 18 hours), increased stem length (25.42–52.88%), and enhanced vitamin C and thiol content, along with antioxidant potency, though effects varied with pressure and exposure time.
population_specificity: Mung bean seeds
effective_dosage: Different oxygen plasma pressures (up to 60 Pa) and exposure times (up to 30 minutes)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of UV-C irradiation treatment on Fusarium-infected wheat seeds during germination, focusing on mycotoxin inhibition and germination rate improvement.
results_summary: UV-C irradiation promoted germination rates in infected wheat seeds and significantly inhibited Fumonisins and Beauvericin mycotoxins, though Enniatins production increased with long-term UV-C exposure. Short-term UV treatment (15 min) was most effective for mycotoxin inhibition.
population_specificity: Fusarium-infected wheat seeds

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and characterize innovative electrode materials for lithium-ion batteries, specifically using fig seeds to produce carbon-based anode materials.
results_summary: The study found that carbon anodes derived from fig seeds exhibited dominant graphitic properties and, when paired with TiO2-coated NMC622, delivered superior performance in lithium-ion batteries compared to uncoated NMC622 full cells.
population_specificity: Not applicable (materials research, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of non-uniform 300 mT static magnetic field (SMF) treatment on the germination, seedling growth, enzyme activities, and chlorophyll content of Platycodon grandiflorum seeds.
results_summary: The study found that 300 mT SMF treatment did not significantly affect germination rates but increased catalase, superoxide dismutase, α-and β-amylase activities, and chlorophyll content in Hebei seeds, while reducing root length and MDA levels in Anhui seeds.
population_specificity: Platycodon grandiflorum seeds from Anhui and Hebei regions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a Y-shaped airway stent loaded with 125I seeds for treating recurrent tracheal adenoid cystic carcinoma (TACC).
results_summary: The study found that the stent loaded with 125I seeds was well-tolerated and effective, with no signs of relapse or progression during a 5-year follow-up period. The patient experienced favorable short-term outcomes and long-term stability post-treatment.
population_specificity: A 50-year-old man with recurrent tracheal adenoid cystic carcinoma (TACC).
effective_dosage: Not specified (125I seeds loaded in a stent).
study_duration: 5 months (stent was removed after this period).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize sainfoin seeds' food potential by assessing their composition, enzyme activity, and antinutrient content, and to optimize processing methods to reduce antinutrients and inactivate enzymes.
results_summary: Sainfoin seeds contain high protein (42%) and dietary fiber (45%), but also significant antinutrients like phytic acid and tannins. Infrared treatment (2000 W, 75 s) effectively inactivated enzymes, while optimal processing conditions varied for reducing antinutrients and preserving quality.
population_specificity: Not specified (study focused on seed composition and processing, not human or animal trials).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study assessed processing methods, not dosage).
study_duration: Not applicable (study focused on processing conditions, not intervention duration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the chemopreventive potential and antioxidant capacity of marolo seed byproducts (MSAF and MSFF) and their effects on DNA damage.
results_summary: MSFF showed higher antioxidant activity and chemopreventive effects at lower doses (3.5 and 7.0 mg/day), while MSAF exhibited chemopreventive effects only at a higher dose (28 mg/day). Both flours showed no significant cytotoxic or mutagenic effects.
population_specificity: Swiss mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of peanuts on metabolic syndrome (MetS) and cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk factors based on clinical studies.
results_summary: The study found that consuming raw peanuts or processed peanut products improved metabolic parameters such as glycemia, insulinemia, lipids, body mass index, and endothelial function, suggesting potential benefits for MetS and CVD prevention. However, further research is needed to confirm these findings.
population_specificity: Not specified (general population inferred from clinical studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of garden cress seeds (GAC) on reproductive performance, immunity, hormones, protein profile, and milk quality in pregnant rabbits.
results_summary: GAC supplementation significantly increased milk fat and improved serum total protein, globulin, IgG, and IgM levels, with the 3% GAC group showing the best results. No noticeable effects were observed on milk yield or most milk analysis parameters.
population_specificity: Pregnant V-Line rabbits (6-7 months old, initial body weight ~2395.83 g).
effective_dosage: 3%, 4.5%, and 6% GAC supplementation in the basal diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the effects of prickly ash seeds (PASs) on sheep rumen development, growth performance, and the rumen microbiome and its metabolites.
results_summary: Dietary PAS addition improved average daily gain, reduced the F/G ratio, enhanced rumen papilla height and width, altered fermentation parameters (acetate, butyrate, propionate levels), and modulated microbial and metabolite abundances linked to growth-related pathways.
population_specificity: 3-month-old Hu lambs

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential health benefits of Zibibbo grape seeds, focusing on their antioxidant properties and effects on bone metabolism and osteoblast proliferation.
results_summary: The Zibibbo grape seed extract (ZSE) contained significant levels of phenolic compounds and demonstrated strong antioxidant activity (>90%). It also promoted osteoblast proliferation and modulated bone metabolism-related pathways, suggesting potential benefits for osteoporosis.
population_specificity: Human osteoblast cell lines (Saos-2 and MG63) were studied, with implications for elderly individuals and those with metabolic disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the nutritional and phytochemical profiles, extraction methods, health benefits, safety, and high-value applications of peony seed oil (PSO).
results_summary: PSO contains high levels of beneficial fatty acids, squalene, tocopherol, and other compounds, demonstrating multiple health benefits including antioxidation, blood lipid reduction, and anti-inflammatory effects. Toxicity studies indicated PSO is safe with no adverse effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human consumption implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of hemp seed alone and combined with aerobic exercise on metabolic markers, oxidative stress, and neurotrophic factors in young sedentary men.
results_summary: Aerobic exercise combined with hemp seed consumption significantly improved weight, body mass index, fat mass, high-density lipoprotein, catalase, and brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF). Hemp seed alone increased high-density lipoprotein levels, while aerobic exercise alone improved body weight, fat mass, and triglycerides.
population_specificity: Sedentary young men in Tabriz, Iran.
effective_dosage: Two 1-g capsules of hemp seed daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of seed nutripriming with zinc as a biofortification strategy to alleviate Zn malnutrition and enhance plant performance in Zn-deficient soils.
results_summary: The study found that seed nutripriming with zinc is a cost-effective and environmentally friendly approach to biofortification, improving germination, growth, yield, and bioavailable Zn in edible crops. Zinc also plays a role in managing COVID-19 symptoms.
population_specificity: Global population suffering from Zn malnutrition, particularly those dependent on Zn-deficient staple foods.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of brachytherapy, including radioactive seeds, in improving conformational radiation doses and reducing toxicity for spinal tumors.
results_summary: The study highlights that brachytherapy, delivered via radioactive seeds or plaques, can supplement external beam radiation to enhance tumor control while minimizing toxicity to critical structures, particularly for metastatic and primary spinal tumors.
population_specificity: Patients with metastatic and primary spinal tumors, including chordomas and high-grade sarcomas.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anticancer and therapeutic properties of thymoquinone (TQ) derived from black cumin seeds, focusing on its mechanisms and effects in various cancer models.
results_summary: TQ demonstrated broad anticancer effects, including inhibition of carcinogenesis, tumor growth arrest, and suppression of metastasis through multiple molecular pathways. It also showed synergistic effects with conventional chemotherapeutic agents.
population_specificity: Animal models and in vitro cancer cell cultures.
interactions: Synergistic effects with chemotherapeutic agents noted; no other interactions mentioned.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review updated toxicological effects of Ginkgo biloba seeds and leaves, including carcinogenic potential and negative clinical trial results.
results_summary: The study found clear evidence of carcinogenic activity in mice from Ginkgo biloba leaf extract, leading to its classification as a possible human carcinogen (Group 2B). Large clinical trials showed negative results, but human case reports indicated toxicological risks.
population_specificity: Rodents (mice) and general human population (case reports and clinical trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of a milled sesame/pumpkin/flax seed mixture on glycemic control, serum lipids, fatty acid status, and inflammatory markers in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The seed mixture significantly improved fatty acid profiles, reduced triglyceride levels, improved glycemic control, and lowered inflammatory markers (TNF-alpha, IL-6, hs-CRP).
population_specificity: Thirty hemodialysis patients (18 male, 12 female) with well nutrition status.
effective_dosage: 30 g daily (6 g sesame, 6 g pumpkin, 18 g flax seeds).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of Nigella sativa L. seeds (NS) on mood, anxiety, and cognition in adolescent males.
results_summary: NS intake showed statistically significant improvements in mood and trait anxiety within the treatment group, as well as some cognitive enhancements, though not all comparisons between groups were significant. No significant changes were observed in the placebo group.
population_specificity: Healthy adolescent males aged 14-17 years in a boarding school in Bangladesh.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Ardeh (ground unhulled sesame seed paste) on lipid profiles and atherogenic lipid parameters in type 2 diabetics to assess its potential in reducing cardiovascular disease risk factors.
results_summary: After six weeks, Ardeh supplementation significantly reduced serum triglycerides (15.3 mg/dL) and atherogenic index of plasma (39%), with slight decreases in total cholesterol, LDL-C, and other atherogenic lipid parameters, and a mild increase in HDL-C. No changes were observed in anthropometric measures or blood pressure.
population_specificity: 41 patients with type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether whole or ground Salba seeds are more effective in reducing postprandial blood glucose levels when incorporated into bread.
results_summary: The study found that both whole and ground Salba seeds equally attenuated blood glucose levels in a dose-dependent manner, with no significant difference between forms. No adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: 13 healthy participants (6 male, 7 female; BMI 25.4±2.6 kg/m²).
effective_dosage: 7 g, 15 g, or 24 g of whole or ground Salba seeds baked into bread.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Nigella sativa seed (NS) on memory, attention, and cognition in healthy elderly volunteers and assess its safety profile over nine weeks.
results_summary: NS significantly improved scores in logical memory tests, digit span, delayed recall, and other neuropsychological tests, with no statistically significant changes in cardiac, liver, or kidney biochemical markers. The study suggests NS enhances memory, attention, and cognition without adverse effects.
population_specificity: Healthy elderly volunteers (40 participants, aged not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether flaxseed-derived enterolignans (enterolactone and enterodiol) could inhibit tumor proliferation markers (NFκB, VEGF, Ki67) in prostate cancer patients.
results_summary: Flaxseed supplementation significantly increased urinary enterolignans, which were inversely correlated with Ki67 (a cell proliferation marker). Enterolactone also showed a near-significant inverse association with VEGF, but no link was found with NFκB.
population_specificity: 147 patients with prostate cancer.

study_goal: To investigate the effects of Nigella sativa seed supplementation on symptom levels, immune functions, and hematological parameters in patients with allergic rhinitis undergoing immunotherapy.
results_summary: Nigella sativa seed supplementation significantly improved phagocytic and intracellular killing activities of PMNs in patients receiving immunotherapy, and increased CD8 counts. Healthy volunteers also showed improved PMN functions after supplementation.
population_specificity: 24 patients with allergic rhinitis sensitive to house dust mites and 8 healthy volunteers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of selenium (Se) enrichment on Se accumulation, selenoprotein distribution, and phenolic acid metabolism in barley.
results_summary: Selenium was primarily distributed in protein, with selenomethionine (Se-Met) treatment yielding the highest Se-protein concentration. Se treatments enhanced Se accumulation in specific molecular weight proteins and upregulated genes related to phenolic acid metabolism, with Se-Met treatment significantly increasing phenolic acid content.
population_specificity: Barley (Hordeum vulgare)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether SELENBP1 influences sepsis outcomes by regulating immune cell activity, particularly dendritic cells and the Treg/Th17 ratio.
results_summary: The study found that SELENBP1 knockout improved survival in septic mice by reducing liver damage, lowering inflammation, increasing the Treg/Th17 ratio, and inducing a tolerogenic DC phenotype. These effects suggest SELENBP1 regulates immune activity in sepsis.
population_specificity: Sepsis patients (human blood samples) and septic mice (animal model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of Selenium nanoparticles (SeNPs) in combating infectious diseases and their potential mechanisms of action.
results_summary: SeNPs demonstrated significant therapeutic potential, including antibacterial, antiviral, and anti-inflammatory properties, with better absorption and bioavailability compared to micron-size particles. They also showed promise in treating cancer, diabetes, and detoxifying heavy metals.
population_specificity: Not specified (general microbial and disease applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether selenium (Na2SeO3) could protect human brain endothelial cells from oxidative stress and BBB disruption caused by hypertensive shear stress.
results_summary: Selenium (Na2SeO3) showed limited efficacy in preserving tight junction protein ZO-1 localization and preventing NRF2 translocation, with only modest improvements observed in some replicates.
population_specificity: Human brain endothelial cells (HBCE5i) exposed to hypertensive shear stress in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of selenium-doped carbon quantum dots (Se-CQDs) in combination with Astilbin (AST) for enhancing diabetic wound healing by reducing oxidative stress and inflammation while promoting angiogenesis.
results_summary: The study found that Se-CQDs effectively scavenged reactive oxygen species (ROS), alleviating oxidative stress, while AST exhibited anti-inflammatory and pro-angiogenic effects, collectively accelerating wound repair in diabetic wounds. The sequential release mechanism of the dual-layer microneedle system demonstrated synergistic therapeutic benefits.
population_specificity: Diabetic wounds (DW) in a preclinical model (specific human or animal population not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effects of magnetic seed treatment (MST) on tomato plants during the vegetative stage, comparing physiological responses, growth dynamics, and performance against untreated low-cost and high-cost seeds.
results_summary: MST improved physiological responses and growth dynamics in tomato plants, with treated low-cost seeds performing comparably to high-cost commercial seeds. The treatment persistently enhanced biomass accumulation and structural development throughout the vegetative stage.
population_specificity: Tomato plants (225 experimental units across three groups).
effective_dosage: Not specified (magnetic treatment parameters not detailed).
study_duration: Duration of vegetative stage (exact timeframe not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of muscadine grape seed supplementation on endothelial function and cardiovascular risk factors in subjects with increased cardiovascular risk.
results_summary: The study found no significant improvement in brachial flow-mediated dilation or other biomarkers of inflammation, lipid peroxidation, or antioxidant capacity with muscadine grape seed supplementation. However, there was a significant increase in resting brachial diameter, though its clinical significance remains unclear.
population_specificity: Adults with coronary disease or at least one cardiac risk factor.
study_duration: 4 weeks per intervention (supplementation and placebo), with a 4-week washout.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the eco-friendly biosynthesis of selenium nanoparticles (SeNPs) using E. coli and assess their antioxidant and anti-proliferative effects on cancer cell lines.
results_summary: The study successfully biosynthesized SeNPs with sizes ranging from 21.96-50.71 nm, demonstrating significant antioxidant activity (80.21% radical scavenging at 100 µg/ml) and potent anti-proliferative effects against colorectal (SW480) and hepatocellular (HepG2) carcinoma cell lines, with negligible cytotoxicity on normal cells (HEK293).
population_specificity: Human colorectal carcinoma (SW480), human hepatocellular carcinoma (HepG2), and normal human embryonic kidney (HEK293) cell lines.
effective_dosage: Sodium selenite concentrations of 25, 50, and 100 mM; SeNPs tested at 100 µg/ml for antioxidant activity and IC50 values of 3.9 µg/ml (SW480) and 4.5 µg/ml (HepG2).
study_duration: 48 hours for biosynthesis; anti-proliferative and antioxidant assays duration not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether selenium nanoparticles (Se NP) could improve drought tolerance in canola plants by enhancing physiological and biochemical attributes.
results_summary: Se NP increased plant growth, boosted chlorophyll biosynthesis, upregulated Krebs cycle enzymes, aided osmotic regulation, and reinforced antioxidant defense mechanisms, thereby improving drought tolerance in canola.
population_specificity: Canola plants subjected to drought stress.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective role of selenium against cadmium-induced hematological, biochemical, and oxidative stress alterations in goldfish.
results_summary: Selenium supplementation alleviated cadmium-induced declines in hematological parameters, reduced liver toxicity markers, and enhanced antioxidant defense mechanisms, effectively counteracting oxidative stress.
population_specificity: Goldfish (aquatic species)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the mechanism by which selenium enhances postpartum uterine healing and examine its effects on oxidative stress and inflammation.
results_summary: Selenium supplementation alleviated endometrial damage, reduced oxidative stress markers (MDA) and inflammatory factors (TNF-α, IL-1β), and upregulated GPX1, GPX4, and NRF2 expression, promoting uterine recovery in postpartum mice.
population_specificity: Female ICR mice aged 8 weeks.
effective_dosage: Low-dose (100 nm), medium-dose (200 nm), and high-dose (400 nm) selenium.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-cancer potential of a novel selenium nanocomposite (CS/S/SeNC) against osteoblastoma cells and assess its biocompatibility.
results_summary: The nanocomposite demonstrated strong dose-dependent inhibition of cancer cell proliferation, induced apoptosis via ROS-mediated mechanisms, and showed biocompatibility through interaction with Decorin. Molecular docking revealed high binding affinity between chitosan (a component of the nanocomposite) and osteocalcin, a cancer-related protein.
population_specificity: Osteoblastoma cells (in-vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of selenium-rich yeast (SeY) on lipid metabolism, antioxidant capacity, and cognitive function in HFD-fed ApoE-/- mice.
results_summary: SeY reduced body weight, lowered TC and TG levels in liver and serum, increased HDL-C levels, enhanced antioxidant capacity (CAT, SOD, GSH-Px), regulated lipid-related mRNA levels, enriched SCFAs-producing bacteria, and alleviated HFD-induced cognitive impairment.
population_specificity: HFD-fed ApoE-/- mice (a model for studying lipid metabolism and cardiovascular disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether low levels of selenium biomarkers (serum selenium, SELENOP, GPx3) are associated with accelerated biological aging measured through epigenetic clocks.
results_summary: The study found that participants with deficient serum selenium levels and those in the lowest quartiles of SELENOP and GPx3 showed accelerated biological aging, with the association for GPx3 remaining significant after multiple testing correction.
population_specificity: 1568 older participants from the Berlin Aging Study II (mean age 68.8 ± 3.7 years, 51% women).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of selenium nanoparticles (functionalized with astragalus polysaccharide and loaded with TSIIA and TMP) for treating spinal cord injury by targeting ferroptosis and microglial polarization.
results_summary: The study found that TSIIA/TMP/APS@Se NPs exhibited anti-ferroptosis properties and regulated microglial polarization, enhancing functional recovery in spinal cord injury models. Both in vitro and in vivo results supported its potential as a comprehensive treatment strategy.
population_specificity: Spinal cord injury models (in vitro and in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether exogenous selenium (Se) could mitigate acid-stress-induced oxidative stress and improve the growth, yield, and quality of Prunella vulgaris.
results_summary: The study found that 5 mg L-1 Se application significantly improved antioxidant enzyme activities, photosynthetic capacity, root architecture, and yield (12.50% increase) while reducing oxidative damage in acid-stressed P. vulgaris. Se also upregulated flavonoid and phenolic acid metabolic pathways, enhancing bioactive compound levels.
population_specificity: Prunella vulgaris plants grown under acidic stress conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the uptake and metabolism of biogenic selenium nanoparticles (SeNPs) by intestinal epithelial cells and their protective effects on intestinal barrier function using a gut-on-a-chip model.
results_summary: SeNPs were effectively taken up by cells, metabolized into selenocystine and selenite, and incorporated into antioxidant selenoenzymes. They alleviated oxidative stress, maintained mitochondrial homeostasis, and reduced inflammation, protecting the intestinal barrier in both in vitro and animal models.
population_specificity: Intestinal epithelial cells (IPEC-J2), mice, and early-weaned piglets.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of nano-selenium-modified biochar in reducing cadmium contamination in soil and enhancing selenium levels in shallots.
results_summary: The study found that nano-selenium-modified biochar significantly reduced bioavailable cadmium in soil and cadmium accumulation in shallot tissues while increasing plant selenium levels and reducing oxidative stress.
population_specificity: Contaminated agricultural soil and shallot plants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a selenium nanozyme-crosslinked injectable composite hydrogel (Se/PRP-OGel) in addressing osteoarthritis by combining ROS scavenging and chondrocyte rejuvenation.
results_summary: The study found that Se/PRP-OGel reduced ROS levels, mitigated chondrocyte senescence, balanced ECM homeostasis, and promoted cartilage repair, pain relief, and functional restoration in an OA rat model.
population_specificity: Osteoarthritis rat model

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the dual effects of selenium (Se) supplementation on silkworm development by analyzing miRNA expression profiles under different Se concentrations.
results_summary: The study found that 50 µM Se improved silkworm productivity by regulating key miRNAs in Toll and Imd signaling pathways, while 200 µM Se had toxic effects, impairing development via miRNA targeting the spliceosome pathway.
population_specificity: Silkworms (Bombyx mori)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the potential therapeutic effects of selenium versus nano-selenium on streptozotocin-induced diabetic retinopathy in rats.
results_summary: The study found that both selenium and nano-selenium improved retinal thickness, reduced oxidative stress markers, and normalized inflammatory and vascular markers in diabetic rats. The improvements were observed biochemically, histologically, and immunohistochemically.
population_specificity: Adult male albino-Wistar rats with streptozotocin-induced diabetic retinopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate selenium-doped Ag/Ag2S Janus nanoparticles (Ag/Ag2SexSy JNPs) for enhancing tumor radiosensitization and real-time imaging in precision cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that selenium-doped nanoparticles improved X-ray absorption, enhanced hydroxyl radical generation, and amplified reactive oxygen species (ROS) production, leading to effective tumor cell apoptosis. Additionally, selenium incorporation improved electron transfer and enabled real-time monitoring of tumor boundaries via NIR-II fluorescence imaging.
population_specificity: Tumor cells (in vitro or preclinical model, not specified for human subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (tunable doping ratios based on selenium precursor input).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the dose-response relationship between selenium supplementation and changes in blood lipid profiles (total, HDL, LDL cholesterol, and triglycerides) in human studies.
results_summary: Selenium administration at or above 200 µg/day decreased HDL and LDL cholesterol while increasing triglycerides, with adverse effects stronger in healthy participants, longer interventions (>3 months), and European populations. At lower baseline intake levels, selenium showed beneficial effects on lipids, indicating a U-shaped dose-response curve.
population_specificity: Healthy individuals, pregnant individuals, and participants with specific health conditions.
effective_dosage: 200 µg/day and above; blood selenium concentrations above 150 µg/L.
study_duration: Varied, with stronger effects in studies longer than 3 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine which form of selenium (Se) enhances radiosensitivity in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) and investigate the mechanism by which selenium nanoparticles (LNT-SeNPs) improve radiotherapy effectiveness.
results_summary: LNT-SeNPs demonstrated significant radiosensitizing activity, inhibiting cell growth, inducing S-phase arrest, and promoting apoptosis via increased ROS production. They also suppressed GPX2 expression, leading to apoptosis through the p53/IGFBP3 pathway, enhancing radiotherapy effectiveness for ESCC.
population_specificity: Esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential antagonistic relationship between selenium and methylmercury accumulation in different life stages of a parthenogenetic mayfly.
results_summary: Selenium reduced methylmercury accumulation in high-methylmercury environments but not in low-methylmercury environments. The study also found that selenium exposure influenced methylmercury transfer between life stages, with synergistic effects observed at low dietary methylmercury levels.
population_specificity: Parthenogenetic mayfly (Neocloeon triangulifer) in aquatic and terrestrial life stages.
effective_dosage: Elevated aqueous selenomethionine (specific concentration not provided).
interactions: Antagonistic interaction with methylmercury in high-methylmercury environments; synergistic enhancement of methylmercury transfer at low dietary methylmercury levels.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of a selenium-albumin nanoaccelerator hydrogel (H-Se NPs-Gel) for wound healing, including antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and anti-scarring properties.
results_summary: H-Se NPs-Gel demonstrated superior antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, and antioxidant properties compared to Se NPs alone, accelerated healing in full-thickness skin defects and diabetic wounds in mice, and effectively inhibited scarring by targeting CD36. It also showed excellent safety without systemic toxicity.
population_specificity: Mice with full-thickness skin defects, diabetic wounds, and hypertrophic scars.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether selenium nanoparticles (Se-NPs) synthesized from wheat extract could mitigate cadmium (Cd) toxicity, reduce Cd uptake, and restore grain nutrient composition in wheat plants.
results_summary: Se-NPs at 25 ppm reduced Cd-induced delays in plant growth, restored grain yield by 90.86%, improved antioxidant enzyme activities by up to 333.79%, and mitigated Cd uptake while maintaining grain nutrient content.
population_specificity: Wheat plants (Triticum aestivum L.) under cadmium stress.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the dual biocatalytic and photothermal capabilities of selenium vacancy-enriched nickel-cobalt selenide (NiCoSe) nanoplatforms for treating multidrug-resistant bacterial pneumonia (MDR-BP).
results_summary: The NiCoSe nanoplatform demonstrated robust ROS generation and potent bactericidal effects, synergistically accelerating biofilm eradication through NIR-II photothermal activation, making it a promising candidate for anti-infective treatment of MDR-BP.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or preclinical study implied by the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether selenium-containing drugs, specifically LNT-SeNPs, could synergistically enhance the antitumor efficacy of Nab-PTX in treating esophageal squamous cell cancer (ESCC) while mitigating adverse effects.
results_summary: The study found that low-dose LNT-SeNPs combined with Nab-PTX improved antitumor efficacy in ESCC cells by promoting apoptosis via SelN-mediated ER stress. In vivo results also showed reduced toxicity and enhanced efficacy with this combination.
population_specificity: KYSE-150 ESCC cell line and KYSE-150 tumor-bearing mice models.
effective_dosage: Low dosage of LNT-SeNPs (specific amount not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if high-dose intravenous selenium had differential treatment effects on mortality and other outcomes across four sepsis phenotypes.
results_summary: The study found no robust effect of selenium on mortality or other outcomes in any sepsis phenotype. Phenotype-specific mortality differences were observed but were not statistically significant.
population_specificity: 1089 patients with sepsis or septic shock from the SISPCT trial.
effective_dosage: High-dose intravenous selenium (specific amount not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Selenium yeast (SeY) could mitigate LPS-induced inflammation and oxidative stress while preserving milk synthesis pathways in porcine mammary epithelial cells (PMECs).
results_summary: SeY significantly reduced LPS-induced pro-inflammatory cytokines (TNF-α, IL-6, IL-8, IL-1β), enhanced antioxidant defenses (T-AOC, SOD, GSH, GSH-Px), decreased oxidative damage (MDA), and restored lipid droplet formation and milk synthesis regulators.
population_specificity: Porcine mammary epithelial cells (PMECs)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether selenium and coenzyme Q10 supplementation affects CD5L levels, thyroid hormone activity, health-related quality of life, and mortality in an elderly population with low selenium status.
results_summary: Selenium and coenzyme Q10 supplementation significantly increased CD5L and free tri-iodothyronine (fT3) levels, correlating with improved health outcomes, including reduced cardiovascular mortality and better health-related quality of life. Low baseline CD5L was associated with worse outcomes in the placebo group.
population_specificity: Elderly, community-living individuals with low selenium status (mean plasma selenium: 67 µg/L).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of varying dietary selenium-enriched yeast (SeY) levels on intestinal health, antioxidant activity, and colonic bacterial communities in growing-finishing pigs.
results_summary: SeY at 0.3 mg/kg improved intestinal morphology, mucus production, and antioxidant activity, while high doses (5 mg/kg) caused mucosal damage. SeY also altered colonic bacterial communities and short-chain fatty acid concentrations.
population_specificity: 90-day-old Duroc×Landrace×Yorkshire growing-finishing pigs (average body weight 54.37±2.13 kg).
effective_dosage: 0.3, 1, 3, and 5 mg/kg SeY in the diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effects of polydopamine-coated selenium nanoparticles (PDA-SeNPs) in treating osteoarthritis (OA), focusing on cartilage repair, anti-inflammatory effects, and pain reduction.
results_summary: PDA-SeNPs enhanced cartilage-regeneration markers and reduced inflammation in vitro, while in vivo, they improved weight-bearing capacity and mitigated cartilage damage more effectively than uncoated SeNPs in OA-induced rats.
population_specificity: Rats with monoiodoacetate-induced osteoarthritis.

study_goal: To evaluate whether oral selenium supplementation improves clinical recovery in children under five with acute lower respiratory tract infections (ALRTI).
results_summary: Oral selenium (20-30 mcg/day) did not significantly reduce clinical recovery time or hospital stay duration but reduced the need for mechanical ventilation compared to placebo. No side effects were reported.
population_specificity: Children aged 6 months to 5 years hospitalized with ALRTI at a tertiary care hospital.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of dual-targeted selenium nanoparticles (SST/MOS@EUP-SeNP) in treating ulcerative colitis by enhancing intestinal barrier function, reducing inflammation, and modulating gut microbiota.
results_summary: The study found that SA/SST/MOS@EUP-SeNP effectively targeted inflamed colon tissue, improved intestinal barrier function, reduced inflammation, enhanced antioxidant capacity, and regulated gut microbiota, significantly alleviating DSS-induced colitis. The nanoparticles also demonstrated excellent biocompatibility in vivo and in vitro.
population_specificity: The study focused on a model of DSS-induced colitis, likely in animals (specific species not mentioned in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a selenium-based probiotic (Se@EcN-C2/A2) for treating colitis by addressing oxidative stress, inflammatory responses, and gut microbial dysbiosis.
results_summary: Se@EcN-C2/A2 effectively scavenged oxidative stress, regulated macrophage phenotypes to suppress inflammation, restored gut barrier functions, and improved microbial balance by reducing harmful bacteria (Escherichia-Shigella) and increasing beneficial bacteria (Lactobacillus and Bifidobacterium).
population_specificity: DSS-induced colitis mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cytotoxicity of selenium-incorporated N-heterocyclic carbene (NHC) compounds against HeLa cells and their potential as targeted chemotherapeutic agents.
results_summary: The selenium NHC compounds (C1 and C2) demonstrated strong cytotoxicity against HeLa cells, with IC50 values lower than the positive control, and induced apoptosis, autophagy, and mitochondrial membrane disruptions. The compounds also showed DNA-binding affinity and inhibited thioredoxin reductase enzymes.
population_specificity: HeLa cancer cell lines (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: IC50 values of 14.65 ± 0.66 μg/mL (C1) and 8.05 ± 0.35 μg/mL (C2).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and acceptability of a 1% selenium disulfide (SeS2)-0.9% salicylic acid shampoo in treating mild to moderate scalp seborrheic dermatitis (SSD) among dermatologists.
results_summary: The shampoo significantly reduced severe dandruff cases from 28.4% to 3.2%, with 90.5% of participants reporting mild or no dandruff. Visual Analog Scale (VAS) scores showed significant improvement in all symptoms (p < 0.01), and 88.5% of participants were satisfied with the product.
population_specificity: 95 dermatologists with mild to moderate scalp seborrheic dermatitis (SSD).
effective_dosage: 1% selenium disulfide (SeS2) and 0.9% salicylic acid shampoo, used thrice weekly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of Se-tolerant LF-17 agents and exogenous Na2SeO3 on the growth, enzyme activity, and metabolic characteristics of rape seedlings to improve Se bioavailability and mitigate Se toxicity.
results_summary: Treatment with Se-tolerant LF-17 agents and Na2SeO3 significantly increased plant height (38.62%) and fresh weight (116.7%), reduced oxidative stress, and upregulated stress-resistant metabolic pathways.
population_specificity: Rape seedlings (Brassica napus)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential preventive and therapeutic benefits of selenium in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and explore its mechanisms of action.
results_summary: The review highlights selenium's potential benefits in HCC by influencing risk factors, proliferation, metastasis, and the immune microenvironment, though results are inconsistent and mechanisms remain unclear.
population_specificity: Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) patients and risk factor populations (viral infections, metabolic abnormalities, lifestyle factors).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the association between Selenium intake and hypertension risk, as well as its potential combined effect with Vitamin C.
results_summary: The study found a significant negative correlation between Selenium intake and hypertension risk. High combined intake of Selenium and Vitamin C was associated with a lower risk of hypertension, though no synergistic effect was observed.
population_specificity: 9,343 women aged 20 years and older from NHANES (2011-2020).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anticancer effects of a nanocomplex containing rosmarinic acid and selenium (Se-TiO2-GO) on prostate cancer cells.
results_summary: The nanocomplex (rosmarinic acid@Se-TiO2-GO) reduced cell viability, increased apoptosis, elevated ROS levels, decreased antioxidant capacity, and modulated Bax/Bcl-2 gene expression in prostate cancer cells (PC3, LNCaP) while sparing normal cells (HFF-1).
population_specificity: Prostate cancer cell lines (PC3, LNCaP) and normal fibroblast cell line (HFF-1).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how selenium supplementation affects the toxicity of VC/VK3 in cancer cells and its role in antioxidant protection.
results_summary: Selenium supplementation protected cancer cells from VC/VK3-induced toxicity by enhancing antioxidant selenoprotein expression and activity, including thioredoxin reductases (TXNRDs) and glutathione reductases (GPXs). Inhibiting these antioxidant systems increased VC/VK3 toxicity, suggesting selenium-mediated resistance mechanisms.
population_specificity: Human glioblastoma and non-transformed glial cell lines (in vitro study).
interactions: VC/VK3 competes with thioredoxin (TXN) for electrons, impairing peroxiredoxin 1 (PRDX1).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate serum selenium levels in pediatric cancer patients at diagnosis and after treatment, comparing them to normal references and analyzing differences by tumor type and disease extent.
results_summary: Initial selenium levels were comparable to normal references and showed no significant differences across subgroups. However, selenium levels significantly decreased in solid tumor patients 3-4 months after treatment, possibly due to tumor selenophilic nature, reduced dietary intake, or chemotherapy effects. No survival differences were linked to selenium levels.
population_specificity: Pediatric cancer patients (<18 years) with newly diagnosed lymphomas or solid tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether selenium nanoparticles, combined with chitosan, doxycycline, and zinc, enhance skin wound healing in mice.
results_summary: The study found that selenium nanoparticles, when combined with other compounds, significantly reduced wound surface area, inflammation, and hemorrhage while improving angiogenesis, collagen fiber orientation, and re-epithelialization compared to other groups. The CsDZnS group showed the most effective results in skin healing.
population_specificity: Fifty mice with experimental skin wounds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how bicarbonate and selenium (Se6+) interact to affect cadmium (Cd2+) transport, growth, and photosynthesis in the selenium hyperaccumulator plant Cardamine violifolia.
results_summary: Se6+ improved intracellular water-holding capacity, nutrient transfer rates, and reduced Cd2+ translocation. Low bicarbonate (1 mM) enhanced Se6+ translocation and plant growth, while high bicarbonate (15 mM) inhibited Se6+ translocation and reduced biomass.
population_specificity: Cardamine violifolia (a selenium hyperaccumulator plant species).
effective_dosage: 0.46 mM Se6+ and 0.27 mM Cd2+ (with varying bicarbonate levels: 1 mM and 15 mM).
interactions: Bicarbonate (HCO3-) influenced Se6+ and Cd2+ translocation dynamics.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of a curcumin-selenium nanoemulsion in mitigating Alzheimer's disease symptoms induced by aluminium chloride in rats.
results_summary: The curcumin-selenium nanoemulsion improved behavioral performance, reduced oxidative stress markers (Aβ, p53, tau, TNF-α), enhanced antioxidant enzyme activity (CAT, SOD), and improved brain histology and memory deficits in AD rats.
population_specificity: Alzheimer's disease model rats induced by aluminium chloride.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether exosomal miRNAs, particularly miR-22, mediate selenium's lipid-reducing effects in the liver of grass carp.
results_summary: Selenium up-regulated miR-22, reduced liver lipid content, and suppressed the FGFR1-PI3K-AKT-mTOR pathway. Exosomes enriched with miR-22 from Se-treated hepatocytes also reduced triglycerides in oleic acid-treated hepatocytes.
population_specificity: Grass carp (fish species)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-tumor efficacy and biocompatibility of a PCL/CS nanofibrous scaffold loaded with selenium nanoparticles (Se NPs) and paclitaxel (PTX) for melanoma treatment.
results_summary: The PTX-Se NPs PCL/CS scaffold demonstrated high toxicity (>90%) and apoptosis (>85%) in A375 melanoma cells, along with controlled release of compounds and high biocompatibility. The scaffold also exhibited favorable physical properties, including high tensile strength and fluid absorption capacity.
population_specificity: A375 melanoma cells (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: 5 wt% Se NPs and PTX loaded into PCL/CS nanofibers.
study_duration: Not specified (controlled release over several days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effects of selenium-hydroxytyrosol nanocomposites (Se-HTNPs) in mitigating diethylnitrosamine (DEN)-induced hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in rats.
results_summary: Se-HTNPs significantly improved liver function markers, reduced oxidative stress, decreased inflammatory and apoptotic markers, and suppressed key signaling pathways involved in HCC progression. The findings suggest Se-HTNPs have potent antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and anti-carcinogenic properties.
population_specificity: Rats with DEN-induced hepatocellular carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of silver-selenium nanocomposites in treating fire blight disease in pear plants and improving fruit yield and quality.
results_summary: The study found that treatment with 50 ppm Ag-Se nanocomposites improved morphological, physiological, and biochemical parameters in pear plants, as well as enhanced fruit metrics like vitamin C, pH, and juice content. The results suggest potential resistance enhancement against fire blight.
population_specificity: Pear plants (Pyrus communis L.) infected with fire blight (Erwinia amylovora) in Chakwal district, Punjab, Pakistan.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of selenium-enriched ionic fertilizer on cucumber growth, powdery mildew control, and nutritional quality.
results_summary: Selenium at 6 mg/L and 12 mg/L promoted cucumber growth and yield, improved fruit quality, and reduced powdery mildew damage. The 6 mg/L treatment was particularly effective in disease control, comparable to fungicide treatments.
population_specificity: Greenhouse-grown cucumbers
effective_dosage: 0 mg/L, 3 mg/L, 6 mg/L, and 12 mg/L selenium-enriched ionic fertilizer solutions

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of selenium nanoparticles (SeNPs) and their modified forms in preserving fresh-cut bitter bamboo shoots by evaluating their antioxidant activity and stability.
results_summary: SA&SeNPs-sa demonstrated superior antioxidant activity (57.91% DPPH and 55.80% ABTS+ radical scavenging rates) and stability compared to SeNPs and SeNPs-sa, effectively delaying yellowing, reducing weight loss, and inhibiting microbial proliferation in fresh-cut bitter bamboo shoots.
population_specificity: Fresh-cut bitter bamboo shoots (Pleioblastus amarus).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate selenium-loaded micelles functionalized with folic acid for targeted tumor delivery in antitumor therapy.
results_summary: The study found that FA-OSAS-SeNPs demonstrated good stability, targeted inhibitory effects on cervical cancer (HeLa) cells, and increased intracellular ROS levels, inducing apoptosis.
population_specificity: Cervical cancer (HeLa) cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the neuroprotective role of Selenium against TRPV1-mediated oxidative damage, mitochondrial dysfunction, and apoptosis in oxaliplatin-induced neuropathic pain.
results_summary: Selenium suppressed oxaliplatin-induced increases in TNF-α, IL-1β, IL-6, mitochondrial oxidative stress, apoptosis, and TRPV1 overactivation in DRG and SN neurons. It also reversed oxaliplatin-induced reductions in glutathione peroxidase and increases in malondialdehyde levels.
population_specificity: Adult rats (DRG and SN neurons) and in vitro MCF-7 breast cancer cells.
effective_dosage: 1.5 mg/kg every other day (in vivo), 200 nM for 2 hours (in vitro).
study_duration: 4 weeks (in vivo), 24 hours (oxaliplatin) and 2 hours (selenium) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize and evaluate novel selenium nanoparticles (EBM-SeNPs) derived from Epimedium brevicornum Maxim for their structural characteristics and inhibitory effects against lung cancer.
results_summary: EBM-SeNPs showed no cytotoxicity to human liver cells but effectively induced apoptosis in lung cancer cells, suppressed their growth and migration, and reduced tumors in mice while improving immune organ indices.
population_specificity: Lung cancer cells (in vitro) and tumor-bearing mice (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how selenium nanoparticles (SeNPs) inhibit retinal neovascularization (RNV) and identify a potential treatment for pathological RNV.
results_summary: SeNPs significantly inhibited vascular endothelial cell proliferation in vivo and in vitro by modulating cell cycle-related proteins via the PI3K-AKT-p21 axis, preventing the G1 to S phase transition.
population_specificity: Human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) and mice with oxygen-induced retinopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether chitosan-functionalized selenium nanoparticles (SeNPs@CS) could rejuvenate bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells (BMSCs) and enhance their therapeutic potential for sepsis-induced acute lung injury (ALI).
results_summary: The study found that SeNPs@CS-treated BMSCs improved mitochondrial transfer to damaged alveolar epithelial cells and reduced pro-inflammatory Th17 cell differentiation via miR-20b upregulation, leading to superior efficacy in mitigating ALI compared to conventional BMSC therapy.
population_specificity: Murine models of sepsis-induced acute lung injury.
effective_dosage: Not specified (only nanoparticle size of 100 nm mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how Selenium (Se) deficiency interacts with HT-2 toxin to affect cartilage homeostasis and the role of the Notch signaling pathway in this process.
results_summary: The study found that Se deficiency exacerbated HT-2 toxin-induced cartilage degradation, characterized by chondrocyte necrosis and ECM degradation, while activation of the Notch signaling pathway played a key role in this process. Inhibition of the Notch pathway partially protected against ECM depletion caused by HT-2 toxin and Se deficiency.
population_specificity: Male C57BL/6 mice
study_duration: 4 weeks (Se-deficiency diet) followed by 4 weeks (HT-2 toxin exposure)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate serum selenium levels in patients with subacute thyroiditis (SAT) compared to healthy controls and investigate correlations between selenium status and clinical outcomes.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in serum selenium levels between SAT patients and controls, but lower selenium levels were associated with more severe and painful SAT symptoms. Selenium levels did not affect long-term prognosis, including treatment response, recurrence, or permanent hypothyroidism.
population_specificity: 59 patients with subacute thyroiditis and 50 healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of foliar spraying bio-nano-selenium on selenium uptake, antioxidant enzyme activities, and agronomic traits in three wheat varieties.
results_summary: Bio-nano-selenium significantly increased total and organic selenium content in wheat, enhanced antioxidant enzyme activities, improved agronomic traits like plant height and spike number, and promoted soil nutrient uptake. However, it had limited effects on grain morphology.
population_specificity: Three wheat varieties (Huamai 1168, Huamai 2152, Wanximai 0638).
effective_dosage: Bio-nano-selenium solution with a pure selenium concentration of 5000 mg/kg, applied via foliar spraying.
study_duration: Applied at the early flowering stage of wheat (specific duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how selenium nanoparticles (SeNPs) enhance immune-mediated treatment efficacy against advanced non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
results_summary: The study found that SeNPs promote NK cell proliferation and enhance cytotoxicity against cancer cells by activating the mTOR signaling pathway, leading to improved antitumor responses. A clinical trial showed an 83.3% objective response rate and 100% disease control rate when SeNPs were combined with bevacizumab/cisplatin/pemetrexed.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced NSCLC and healthy volunteers (for comparison).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and characterize selenium oxyanion-reducing bacteria (SeRB) in flue gas desulfurization (FGD) wastewater to enhance bioremediation and selenium recovery.
results_summary: The study identified novel selenium-reducing bacteria (Anaerosolibacter, Mesobacillus, Tepidibacillus) and characterized their ability to convert soluble selenium oxyanions into insoluble elemental selenium, improving bioremediation potential. The biogenic selenium produced was predominantly amorphous or hexagonal in structure.
population_specificity: Microbial communities in flue gas desulfurization (FGD) wastewater.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of Selenoprotein T (SelT) and Ca2+/CaMKII signaling in low selenium diet-induced skeletal muscle damage in broilers.
results_summary: The study found that selenium deficiency caused skeletal muscle damage and atrophy, reduced SelT protein levels, and impaired myotube formation by suppressing CaMKII activation. Overexpressing SelT promoted myotube growth, while miR-365-3p inhibited myoblast differentiation by targeting SelT mRNA.
population_specificity: 1-day-old Ross 308 male broilers and chicken embryo models.
effective_dosage: Not specified (low-selenium diet vs. normal diet).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Selenium Nanoparticles-Loaded Extracellular Vesicles combined with Interleukin-32 and Engineered Probiotic Escherichia coli Nissle 1917 (SeNVs@NE-IL32-EcN) could enhance CD8+ T cell-mediated immune responses and overcome immunotherapy resistance in colorectal cancer.
results_summary: The study found that SeNVs@NE-IL32-EcN significantly improved CD8+ T cell proliferation and activity, reduced tumor progression, and demonstrated biocompatibility and antioxidant properties, enhancing CRC immunotherapy while mitigating immune tolerance.
population_specificity: Humanized xenograft mouse model and in vitro assays (immunotherapy-resistant colorectal cancer context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of a selenium-glutathione nanozyme (GSH-Se) as a treatment for ulcerative colitis by assessing its antioxidative and anti-inflammatory effects.
results_summary: GSH-Se supplementation improved colonic mucosal integrity, reduced inflammation and oxidative stress, and alleviated gut microbiota imbalance in DSS-induced colitis mice. The effects were likely mediated by activation of the Nrf2/Keap1 and GPx4 signaling pathways.
population_specificity: Mice with DSS-induced colitis
effective_dosage: 6 mM, 12 mM, and 18 mM of GSH-Se

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore whether Selenium could help prevent the transition from Hashimoto's thyroiditis to Graves' disease in autoimmune thyroid disease patients.
results_summary: The study suggests Selenium may be beneficial in autoimmune thyroid disease (both Hashimoto's thyroiditis and Graves' disease) and could potentially prevent the transition from Hashimoto's to Graves' disease, though more research is needed.
population_specificity: Patients with autoimmune thyroid disease (Hashimoto's thyroiditis and Graves' disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how steam processing affects the form, structure, and biological properties of selenopolysaccharides in Chlamys nobilis.
results_summary: Steaming altered the structure of selenopolysaccharides, reducing absorption strength of chemical bonds and converting β-type pyranose to α-type. SZ-3 (steamed) showed higher bioaccessibility and cellular transport rates compared to SS-3 (raw) and sodium selenite in vitro.
population_specificity: In vitro (Caco-2 cell model) and simulated gastrointestinal digestion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether selenium- and zinc-biofortified bean sprouts could mitigate cognitive dysfunction and slow aging in a mouse model of aging.
